    • setBounds

      public void setBounds(Double southWestLng, Double southWestLat, Double northEastLng, Double northEastLat)
      Provides the geocoder with a hint to the region that the query resides in. This value will restrict the possible results to the supplied region. The value of the bounds parameter should be specified as two coordinate points forming the south-west and north-east corners of a bounding box. For example: bounds=-0.563160,51.280430,0.278970,51.683979 (min lon, min lat, max lon, max lat).

      Values that are not valid coordinates are ignored.

      Parameters:
      southWestLng - south west longitude
      southWestLat - south west latitude
      northEastLng - north east longitude
      northEastLat - north east latitude

    • getRestrictToCountryCode

      public String getRestrictToCountryCode()
      restrict to Country Code
      Returns:
      String

    • setRestrictToCountryCode

      public void setRestrictToCountryCode(String restrictToCountryCode)
      Restricts the results to the given country.
      Parameters:
      restrictToCountryCode - 2 character code as defined by the ISO 3166-1 Alpha 2 standard. E.g. 'gb' for the United Kingdom, fr for France

    • setQueryPartSeparator

      public void setQueryPartSeparator(String queryPartSeparator)
      If you use the query part constructor this String separates the query parts from each other. Defaults to a colon.
      Parameters:
      queryPartSeparator - the query part separator. Defaults to a colon.
